thread.title: Area to host Blue-Grey high school football all-star bowl game at EverBank
thread.title_full: Area to host Blue-Grey high school football all-star bowl game at EverBank

author: Justin Barney
title: Area to host Blue-Grey high school football all-star bowl game at EverBank
text:
Area to host Blue-Grey high school football all-star bowl game at EverBank 
By Justin Barney Thu, Oct 15, 2015 @ 10:13 am | updated Thu, Oct 15, 2015 @ 11:19 am Photos File photo The Blue-Grey All-American Bowl, a high school football all-star game, will be coming to the area and played at EverBank Field. 
The Blue-Grey All-American Bowl, a high school football all-star game, will be coming to the area and played at EverBank Field. The game will be played Jan. 16, 2016. 
SMG and JAXSPORTS will hold a 5:30 p.m. news conference that will include local players, and a handful from around the state, to officially unveil plans for the game. 
The Blue-Grey bowl series has three formats. The first (East-West) will be held Dec. 20, 2015 at the Dallas Cowboys AT&T Stadium. The North-South game is Jan. 9, 2016 at Raymond James Stadium in Tampa Bay. 
The game will include players both locally and from out of the area. It marks a major return of high school football all-star activity in the area. The Shrine Bowl was the area's biggest, first being played here in 1949. It moved around the state until returning to the First Coast in 1989. 
The Shrine Bowl was originally a statewide all-star game, although eventually began failing to draw premier athletes from around Florida as bigger showcase events sprouted up. It shifted to an all-local format in 2001 and played its final game in 2012, due to lack of financial backing.
